intro: Uragoga travancorica, commonly known as the Travancore urara, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of evergreen forests, often near streams or in rocky terrains. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, while its stems are woody and branching. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
